info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 17 at 3:50PM EDT until August 17 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Chatham.
* WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 350 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Midtown Savannah, Downtown Savannah, Hunter Army Airfield, Windsor Forest, Hutchinson Island, Coffee Bluff, Wilmington Island, Montgomery, Garden City and Thunderbolt.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Heavy rain in Downtown Savannah will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
